excerpt: A vegetarian twist on the classic Italian pasta dish, made with hearty lentils and meaty mushrooms.

ingredients.name: Mushrooms, sliced
ingredients.notes: Portobello or cremini mushrooms work well

instructions.name: Bolognese Sauce
instructions: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and saute for 2-3 minutes, until softened.
Add the carrots and celery and saute for another 5 minutes, until softened.
Add the mushrooms and saute for 5-7 minutes, until they release their moisture and start to brown.
Add the lentils, canned tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, and salt and pepper to the pot, stirring well to combine.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and let simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
While the sauce simmers, prepare the pasta according to its package directions. Be sure to salt the cooking water.
Serve the bolognese sauce over the cooked pasta, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
